result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Latonyia L Blanton in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case to follow 15CM1306. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

BRANCH 45 for BRANCH 45.   Case scheduled for sentencing hearing along with 15CM1306.  Due to court congestion and defendant needing to report to work by 4:00 pm, case is adjourned to Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant to attend meeting date with attorney placed on the record. Defense will contact court if defendant fails to appear, and a bench warrant will be issued. Defendant Latonyia L Blanton in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case set for final pretrial conference.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect pursuant to Wis. Stats. 971.15(91).  The Court orders (and by stipulation of the parties) that Dr. Deborah Collins be appointed to examine the defendant pursuant to Wis. Stats. 971.16(2).  Order Appointing Doctor signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for Return on the Doctor's Report.   The 11/16/15 jury trial is vacated.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.
